title: Former US Vice President Pence testifies before grand jury
description: Mike Pence was subpoenaed to testify about the events leading up to the 2021 US Capitol attack by Trump supporters.

title: Sudan’s army and RSF say ceasefire extended but fighting goes on
description: Military and Rapid Support Forces agree to extend truce, but violence continues to rock Khartoum and Darfur region.

title: Washington Declaration: What it means for the Korean Peninsula
description: The US and South Korea sign a pact to counter the nuclear threat posed by North Korea.

title: ‘Very difficult’: Challenges abound after summit on Venezuela
description: Conference in Colombian capital marks positive step, analysts say, but quick fix to Venezuelan crisis unlikely.

title: US to open Latin America migration centres, expedite deportations
description: Group calls move to address an expected spike in border crossings a 'Faustian bargain' as COVID-19 expulsion rule ends.

title: Israeli army kills alleged Palestinian attacker in West Bank
description: The Israeli army says the man tried to stab a policeman with a knife before they opened fire.

title: Ukraine has received 98% of promised combat vehicles: NATO chief
description: NATO allies have provided Ukraine with 1,550 armoured vehicles and 230 tanks to help it retake territory from Russians.

title: US woman whose accusation led to Emmett Till murder dies
description: The brutality of Till's 1955 lynching, on display at his open-casket funeral, galvanised the US civil rights movement.

title: India accuses China of violating border agreements
description: Indian defence minister held 'frank discussions' with his Chinese counterpart, India’s defence ministry says.

title: Pentagon leak suspect had ‘arsenal of weapons’, prosecutors say
description: Defence lawyers argue 21-year-old Jack Teixeira should be released on bond, saying weapons were 'lawfully owned'.

title: Rohingya, Yemeni and Syrian refugees plead for help in Sudan
description: People had fled to Sudan to escape conflict and persecution in their home countries, but are now on the move again.

title: Top US newspapers call for Evan Gershkovich’s release in Russia
description: Russia's foreign ministry says it denied a US consular visit request for journalist amid growing calls for his release.

title: A threat to Kim Jong Un? What the Washington Declaration means
description: We take a look at the significance of the declaration, and whether it could make North Korea change its direction.

title: Iran seizes oil tanker ‘trying to flee’ in Gulf waters
description: Tehran says its navy seized the Marshall Islands-flagged tanker after it hit an Iranian boat.

title: Middle East round-up: Civilians flee Sudan
description: Here's a round-up of Al Jazeera's Middle East and North Africa coverage this week.

title: US economy slows sharply in January-March quarter
description: Businesses slashed inventories in fear of an upcoming downturn while high interest rates hammered the housing market.

title: Erdogan thanks Putin for his help on Turkish nuclear plant
description: The two leaders spoke prior to the inauguration of the Akkuyu plant, Turkey's first nuclear power reactor.

title: Turkish citizens living abroad start voting in general election
description: More than three million citizens living abroad have started casting their ballots in a hotly contested poll.

title: Jerry Springer, US talk show host and former mayor, dies at 79
description: Springer's tabloid TV show often featured sexual themes and family conflict and reached millions over a 27-year run.

title: Shifting alliances in Sudan’s Darfur as new civil war fears rise
description: Locals in Darfur arm themselves, believing army-RSF conflict could reignite ethnic violence and open war in region.

title: Finnish PM-designate to start coalition talks with far right
description: The nationalist Finns Party received 20.1 percent of the vote, while Orpo's NCP did little better, with 20.8 percent.

title: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif wins vote of confidence
description: Sharif secures 180 votes, against the 172 required to achieve a simple majority in the lower house of the parliament.

title: Asylum-seeking former Wagner fighter sentenced in Norway
description: Andrey Medvedev, who fled from Russia last year, is handed a two-week suspended sentence for disorderly conduct.

title: How much debt can the US government handle?
description: Democrats and Republicans use the federal budget to decide on the future direction of the country.

title: Ukrainian journalist shot dead in suspected Russian sniper attack
description: Bogdan Bitik was killed as the Italian reporter he was working with, La Repubblica's Corrado Zunino, was injured.

title: EU’s ‘Israeli independence’ message rebuked in Palestine
description: Palestinian leaders, social media users criticise EU commission president for saying Israel makes 'the desert bloom'.

title: Nigeria’s NNPC, Norway’s Golar sign MoU on floating gas plant
description: Africa's biggest oil producer holds some of the world's biggest gas reserves and is seeking investment in the sector.

title: UNICEF: Digital divide hits women harder in poor countries
description: A new report has raised concerns over the disparity in internet access between women and men in low-income countries.

title: Al Jazeera’s Folly Bah Thibault appointed to UN education fund
description: The acclaimed international journalist from Guinea has been appointed as a Global Champion for Education Cannot Wait.

title: As inequality deepens, who will rewrite the rules?
description: The experts and politicians who created this crisis should not be allowed to redesign the economic system.

title: Want to fix the climate? End debt traps
description: Extortionate debt forces nations to pursue climate-unfriendly policies hoping to repay loans. Until the next crisis.

title: More air strikes in Sudan as ceasefire expiry looms
description: Fighting between the army and RSF paramilitary rages for a second straight day in West Darfur's capital, Geneina.

title: Photos: Sudanese and foreigners escape deadly conflict
description: But ceasefire attempts have largely failed so far, causing tens of thousands of people to flee the country.

title: Pope allows women to vote at bishops’ meeting for first time
description: Pope Francis has decided to appoint 70 non-bishop members of the synod and has asked that half are women.

title: Global warming made Horn of Africa drought possible: WWA study
description: Scientists say rising greenhouse gas emissions made the drought in the Horn of Africa at least 100 times more likely.

title: Rebel attacks deepen displacement crisis in DRC’s Ituri province
description: Attacks by CODECO militia, one of 120 rebel groups in the eastern DRC, have displaced hundreds of thousands of people.

title: An unexpected friendship: A barbershop bond amid the Ukraine war
description: How a former Zelenskyy adviser and a Kyiv-based barber struck up a unique friendship just hours before the war began.

title: China to ‘deepen and expand’ military ties with Pakistan
description: Defence ministry makes the statement during the maiden visit of Pakistan army chief General Syed Asim Munir to Beijing.

title: Sudan fighting in its 13th day: A list of key events
description: Battles have killed at least 512 people, wounded more than 4,000 and left some districts of greater Khartoum in ruins.

title: Why the US evacuation from Sudan left Americans behind
description: Most of the estimated 16,000 Americans believed to be in Sudan right now are dual US-Sudanese nationals.

title: How do retirees in France really fare?
description: Do French pensioners fare better than others in developed economies? It depends who you ask and what measure you use.

title: World’s highest railway bridge to open in Kashmir soon
description: The bridge over the Chenab River, taller than the Eiffel Tower, will provide all-weather connectivity with the valley.

title: Chinese police question staff of US consulting firm Bain
description: Incident comes after police last month raided Beijing office of US due diligence firm Mintz Group and detained staff.

title: Uighur refugee dies after nine years in detention in Thailand
description: Mattohti Mattursun was one of 350 Uighur refugees, including children, who were detained in March 2014.

title: US sanctions Sri Lankan governor over civil war killings
description: US to deny visas to North Western Province governor and ex-navy chief Wasantha Karannagoda and his wife.

title: South Korea’s Yoon meets Elon Musk in pitch for investment
description: Yoon touts South Korea as an ideal country for Tesla to build a gigafactory, report says.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 428
description: As the war enters its 428th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Uganda’s Museveni says being LGBTQ should not be criminalised
description: Latest comments suggest president is trying to tone down proposed anti-homosexuality law, one of the world's toughest.

title: Fugees rapper found guilty in US over 1MDB case
description: Prakazrel Michel was convicted on 10 counts after a trial featuring high-profile witnesses including Leonardo DiCaprio.

title: Sudan army chief backs ceasefire extension as skirmishes continue
description: Hundreds have been killed with Khartoum residents struggling to find food, water and other basic supplies.

title: Ukraine gains an edge in Kherson as counteroffensive nears
description: Reports suggest Ukrainian forces may have started securing a foothold among weak Russian defences in southern Ukraine.

title: US Justice Dept sues Tennessee over transgender healthcare law
description: The law, passed in the state's Republican-led statehouse, prohibits youth from receiving gender-affirming care.

title: US House of Representatives passes debt bill, faces Biden veto
description: The Biden administration has called on House Speaker McCarthy to instead raise the debt ceiling 'without conditions'.

title: People are using ChatGPT as a therapist. It may just be the start
description: The prospect of AI treating mental illness is raising a myriad of ethical and practical concerns.
